page.title: 11Industry in Corby
page.content: Hunters Food factory is on the Corby enterprise zone and was built in 1981 and cost over 3 million pounds.Most of their production is geared to the making of potato crisps.The factory is one of the most modern crisp factories in Europe.Corby was chosen by Hunters because of its central position and financial incentives offered.The factory originally employed 300 workers but in 1985 they completed a 1.25 million extension which created 100 jobs.The factory was launched by Minister Peter Walker in July 1981.The firm now claim to have captured 4% of the British snack market and produce about 7 million packets of crisps per week. The crisp manufacturers are well represented in Corby as the town also houses production plants belonging to Golden Wonder and Smiths crisps.
